name: 7 Wonders
citation: The cards discarded this way remain face down and form a discard pile in the center of the table

name: Clans of Caledonia
citation: Note: Players may never hide any information

name: Concordia
citation: All played cards form a personal discard pile showing only the last card played

name: Cytosis: A Cell Biology Game
citation: Cards in a player’s hand are kept secret from other players until completed, [...]

name: El Grande
citation: After making their selections, the players put their unused cards face down in the box. They will not be used in this game

name: Five Tribes
citation: Coins they hold face down (so that the exact amount remains secret from other players) until the end of the game

name: Great Western Trail
citation: However, during the game, you can improve your deck by adding market cattle cards with higher breeding values as well as objective cards to it

name: Hit Z Road
citation: Both cards are resolved in order from left to right, and after resolving the cards, the player keeps them facedown in front of him

name: Ilôs
citation: Use Screens to hide your stock of Resources from the other players

name: Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King
citation: If you have gold left, you should keep it in your hand to hide the amount from the other players

name: Lords of Waterdeep
citation: After you collect the reward, turn the Quest card face down and place it on the “Completed Quests” area of your player mat

name: Magnum Sal
citation: When a tool is used, it is turned face down to indicate that it cannot be used again during this phase

name: Puerto Rico
citation: A player keeps his victory points, unlike his money and goods, secret from the others

name: Red7
citation: If you are not winning the game at the end of your turn, you lose and are out of the round. Place your [...] Palette cards facedown

name: Roll for the Galaxy
citation: Which tiles are beneath the top tile of each construction zone stack are secret. A player may look at tiles in his own stacks at any time. When asked, he must tell other players the size of each stack

name: Sankt Petersburg
citation: The players keep their money secret from others during the game [...]

name: Scythe
citation: While the number of coins you have during the game is not hidden information, you are never required to reveal their total value to other players

name: Sid Meier's Civilization: A New Dawn
Splendor
citation: To reserve a card, a player simply needs to take a face-up development from the middle of the table or [...]. The reserved cards are kept in hand and cannot be discarded

name: Stone Age
citation: Each player stacks his acquired civilization cards face down on the designated space on his player board

name: Terraforming Mars
citation: Events (red cards, C) are collected in a personal pile face down after being played

name: The Castles of Burgundy
citation: All corresponding goods tiles in the player’s goods storage are piled, face-down, onto the goods storage space on the player’s board intended for this purpose

name: The Voyages of Marco Polo
citation: Finally, the player moves the completed Contract Tile face down onto the drawer space of his Player Board

name: Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization
citation: Because civil cards are never drawn secretly, the players may decide that civil cards in hand are public at all times

name: Tigris & Euphrates
citation: All victory point and treasure tokens gained and tiles behind a player’s screen are hidden information; they are kept secret from other players until scoring

name: Tulip Bubble
citation: The guilders and tulip cards you have are hidden information, and should be hidden behind your player screen

name: Yamataï
citation: Take the building tile and place it face down in front of you. At the end of the game, the building will grant you Prestige Points (PPs)

name: Yokohama
citation: All information is public except for Order cards in the possession of players
